channel.title: Client keeps saying 'java' is not recognized
channel.description: i need help everytime i try to open my client it say.'java' is not recognized and i dont know what to do. i tired getting a diffrent client i dl jdk and all the other stuff but its still not working please help someone :( :(...

item.title: Client keeps saying 'java' is not recognized
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Runes Are Cool?, post:6, topic:303497”][quote author=king gauge link=topic=399821.msg2965584#msg2965584 date=1253554445]
Did you set your Environmental Variables, if not then go to the help part in the Server Help or Server Tutorial section (can’t remember now) If so, Make sure that the run/compile is going to your java file, like mine is in "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\java.exe"
[/quote]

Excellent job.:][/quote]

Not really, if the environment variables are set properly, you can just use “java” instead of using the entire file path.

Read full topic
item.source: Client keeps saying 'java' is not recognized

Did you set your Environmental Variables, if not then go to the help part in the Server Help or Server Tutorial section (can’t remember now) If so, Make sure that the run/compile is going to your java file, like mine is in "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\java.exe"

Excellent job.:]

item.description:
@king_gauge wrote:

Did you set your Environmental Variables, if not then go to the help part in the Server Help or Server Tutorial section (can’t remember now) If so, Make sure that the run/compile is going to your java file, like mine is in "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\java.exe"

item.title: Client keeps saying 'java' is not recognized
item.dc:creator: @Runes_Are_Cool Runes Are Cool?
item.description:
@Runes_Are_Cool wrote:

Right click run.bat then click edit and when you see something like this:

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\java.exe” net/com/espeon/Server 5555

Change the in my case 16 to whatever update of JDK you have.

Read full topic
